result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James V Bunda

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on December 19, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

11:04 AM Defendant James V Bunda in court.  Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court for James V Bunda. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. Court reporter appears by zoom. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Case called for Motion Hearing on Motion to Revoke DPA filed on 20CF1806. 22CF1345 is set for a further proceeding. 

State makes arguments in support of Motion to Revoke DPA. 

Defense does not contest the State's Motion to Revoke DPA and requests that sentencing on both cases be combined, and requests a plea/sentencing on 22CF1345 and sentencing hearing on 20CF1806.

For reasons stated on the record the court grants the State's Motion to revoke the DPA filed on 20CF1806, and will set a sentencing hearing. Court will also set a plea/sentencing hearing on 20CF1806.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster. Defendant to have no contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

8:07 AM Defendant James V Bunda in court.  Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court for James V Bunda. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Attorney Kershek is waiving time limits and asking for a status of prelim as this will likely be a waiver. The Court will set this matter for a status of prelim before the Trial Court to tag along with the defendant's other matter.
Hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 11:00 am.
